00137 #define arg_LOOKUP4 op->nfs_argop4_u.oplookup
00138 #define res_LOOKUP4 resp->nfs_resop4_u.oplookup
00139 
00140 int nfs4_op_lookup(  struct nfs_argop4 * op ,   
00141                      compound_data_t   * data,
00142                      struct nfs_resop4 * resp)
00143 {
00144   nfsstat4             nfsStatus ;
00145   fsal_name_t          name ;
00146   char                 strname[MAXNAMLEN] ;
00147   cache_entry_t      * dir_pentry = NULL ;
00148   cache_entry_t      * file_pentry = NULL ;
00149   fsal_attrib_list_t   attrlookup ;
00150   cache_inode_status_t cache_status ;
00151 
00152   fsal_handle_t      * pfsal_handle = NULL ;
00153 
00154   char                 funcname[] = "nfs4_op_lookup" ;
00155   
00156   resp->resop = NFS4_OP_LOOKUP ;
00157   res_LOOKUP4.status =  NFS4_OK  ;
00158   
00159   /* If there is no FH */
00160   if( nfs4_Is_Fh_Empty( &(data->currentFH  ) ) )
00161     {
00162       res_LOOKUP4.status = NFS4ERR_NOFILEHANDLE ;
00163       return res_LOOKUP4.status ;
00164     }
00165   
00166   /* If the filehandle is invalid */
00167   if( nfs4_Is_Fh_Invalid( &(data->currentFH ) ) )
00168     {
00169       res_LOOKUP4.status = NFS4ERR_BADHANDLE ;
00170       return res_LOOKUP4.status ;
00171     }
00172   
00173   /* Tests if the Filehandle is expired (for volatile filehandle) */
00174   if( nfs4_Is_Fh_Expired( &(data->currentFH) ) )
00175     {
00176       res_LOOKUP4.status = NFS4ERR_FHEXPIRED ;
00177       return res_LOOKUP4.status ;
00178     }
00179 
00180   /* Check for empty name */
00181   if( op->nfs_argop4_u.oplookup.objname.utf8string_len == 0 || 
00182       op->nfs_argop4_u.oplookup.objname.utf8string_val == NULL )
00183     {
00184       res_LOOKUP4.status = NFS4ERR_INVAL ;
00185       return res_LOOKUP4.status ;
00186     }
00187 
00188   /* Check for name to long */
00189   if( op->nfs_argop4_u.oplookup.objname.utf8string_len > FSAL_MAX_NAME_LEN )
00190     {
00191       res_LOOKUP4.status = NFS4ERR_NAMETOOLONG ;
00192       return res_LOOKUP4.status ;
00193     }
00194  
00195   /* If Filehandle points to a pseudo fs entry, manage it via pseudofs specific functions */
00196   if( nfs4_Is_Fh_Pseudo( &(data->currentFH) ) )
00197     return nfs4_op_lookup_pseudo( op, data, resp ) ;
00198 
00199 
00200    /* UTF8 strings may not end with \0, but they carry their length */
00201   strncpy( strname, arg_LOOKUP4.objname.utf8string_val, arg_LOOKUP4.objname.utf8string_len ) ;
00202   strname[arg_LOOKUP4.objname.utf8string_len] = '\0' ;
00203 
00204   if( ( cache_status = cache_inode_error_convert( FSAL_str2name( strname,
00205                                                                  MAXNAMLEN,
00206                                                                  &name ) ) ) != CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS )
00207     {
00208       res_LOOKUP4.status = nfs4_Errno( cache_status ) ;
00209       return res_LOOKUP4.status ;
00210     }
00211 
00212   /* No 'cd .' is allowed return NFS4ERR_BADNAME in this case */ 
00213   /* No 'cd .. is allowed, return EINVAL in this case. NFS4_OP_LOOKUPP should be use instead */
00214   if( !FSAL_namecmp( &name, &FSAL_DOT ) || !FSAL_namecmp( &name, &FSAL_DOT_DOT )  )
00215     {
00216       res_LOOKUP4.status = NFS4ERR_BADNAME ;
00217       return res_LOOKUP4.status ;
00218     }
00219   
00220   /* Do the lookup in the HPSS Namespace */
00221   file_pentry = NULL;
00222   dir_pentry = data->current_entry ;
00223   
00224   /* Sanity check: dir_pentry should be ACTUALLY a directory */
00225   if( dir_pentry->internal_md.type != DIR_BEGINNING && dir_pentry->internal_md.type != DIR_CONTINUE )
00226     {
00227        /* This is not a directory */
00228        if( dir_pentry->internal_md.type == SYMBOLIC_LINK )
00229           res_LOOKUP4.status = NFS4ERR_SYMLINK ;
00230        else
00231           res_LOOKUP4.status = NFS4ERR_NOTDIR ; 
00232 
00233        /* Return failed status */
00234        return res_LOOKUP4.status ;
00235     }
00236  
00237   /* BUGAZOMEU: Faire la gestion des cross junction traverse */
00238   if( ( file_pentry = cache_inode_lookup( dir_pentry, 
00239                                           &name, 
00240                                           &attrlookup, 
00241                                           data->ht,
00242                                           data->pclient,
00243                                           data->pcontext, 
00244                                           &cache_status ) ) != NULL )
00245     {
00246       /* Extract the fsal attributes from the cache inode pentry */
00247       pfsal_handle = cache_inode_get_fsal_handle( file_pentry, &cache_status )  ;
00248     
00249       if( cache_status != CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS )
00250         {
00251           res_LOOKUP4.status = NFS4ERR_SERVERFAULT ;
00252           return res_LOOKUP4.status ;
00253         }
00254 
00255       /* Convert it to a file handle */
00256       if( !nfs4_FSALToFhandle( &data->currentFH, pfsal_handle, data ) )
00257         {
00258           res_LOOKUP4.status = NFS4ERR_SERVERFAULT ;
00259           return res_LOOKUP4.status ;
00260         }
00261 
00262       /* Copy this to the mounted on FH (if no junction is traversed */
00263       memcpy( (char *)(data->mounted_on_FH.nfs_fh4_val), 
00264               (char *)(data->currentFH.nfs_fh4_val), data->currentFH.nfs_fh4_len ) ;
00265       data->mounted_on_FH.nfs_fh4_len = data->currentFH.nfs_fh4_len ;
00266       
00267       
00268 #ifdef _DEBUG_NFS_V4
00269       printf( "----> nfs4_op_lookup: name=%s  dir_pentry=%p  looked up pentry=%p\n",
00270               strname, dir_pentry, file_pentry ) ;
00271       printf( "----> FSAL handle parent puis fils dans nfs4_op_lookup\n" ) ;
00272       print_buff( ( char *)cache_inode_get_fsal_handle( file_pentry, &cache_status ), sizeof( fsal_handle_t ) ) ;
00273       print_buff( ( char *)cache_inode_get_fsal_handle( dir_pentry, &cache_status ), sizeof( fsal_handle_t ) ) ;
00274 #endif      
00275 
00276       /* Keep the pointer within the compound data */
00277       data->current_entry = file_pentry ;
00278       data->current_filetype = file_pentry->internal_md.type ;
00279       
00280       /* Return successfully */ 
00281       res_LOOKUP4.status = NFS4_OK ;
00282       return NFS4_OK ;
00283       
00284     }
00285   
00286   /* If the part of the code is reached, then something wrong occured in the lookup process, status is not HPSS_E_NOERROR 
00287    * and contains the code for the error */
00288   
00289   res_LOOKUP4.status = nfs4_Errno( cache_status ) ;
00290 
00291   return res_LOOKUP4.status;
00292 } /* nfs4_op_lookup */
00293 
00294 
00305 void nfs4_op_lookup_Free( LOOKUP4res * resp )
00306 {
00307   /* Nothing to be done */
00308   return ;
00309 } /* nfs4_op_lookup_Free */
